questionsData.title: Clouds are formed from water evaporation
An acid is a Latin word.
Lamas live in so cold places.
A football is rectangular in shape .
To crossbreed an animal with another means to make a new animal.
"A peak" means '' the lowest part of a mountain '' .
Ultrasound is heard by many animals.
A volcano is a mountain with a hole in the top.
During a drought , people starve and die of hunger.
"Diligent" means '' hardworking''.
Destroyed and demolished are synonyms.
Vaccination is the use of a very weak form of a disease.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Vaccines work by exposing your body to a weakened or inactive form of a virus or bacteria. This triggers your immune system to develop antibodies that can fight off the real disease if you encounter it later. 

diseases are spread by germs.and vaccination using a very weak form of the disease could lead to immunity.

questionsData.title: Project manager is somebody who manages schools.
A person who applies for a job is an applicant.
The design of a text is a layout.
Prefixes come after the stem of a word.
questionsData.explain_answer:
No, prefixes come before the stem of a word. The stem is the basic form of the word, without any prefixes or suffixes. Prefixes are added to the beginning of the stem to change its meaning or grammatical function. For example, the prefix "un-" means "not," so the word "unhappy" means "not happy."

Here are some examples of prefixes and their meanings:

  • un- (not): unhappy, untruthful
  • re- (again): rewrite, rebuild
  • pre- (before): preview, prepay
  • dis- (not, the opposite of): dislike, disapprove
  • mis- (badly, wrongly): misspell, misunderstand

Suffixes are added to the end of the stem to change its meaning or grammatical function. For example, the suffix "-er" means "person who does something," so the word "teacher" means "person who teaches."

Here are some examples of suffixes and their meanings:

  • -er (person who does something): teacher, writer
  • -ing (present participle): talking, singing
  • -ed (past tense): walked, talked
  • -able (able to be): lovable, breakable
  • -ous (full of): dangerous, courageous

questionsData.title: Things you use in cooking are ingredients.
Brine is a kind of salted liquid .
The sun is closer to the earth than the moon.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The moon is much closer to Earth than the sun. In fact, the sun is an enormous distance away compared to the moon.

  • The moon is approximately 238,855 miles (384,400 kilometers) from Earth.
  • The sun is a staggering 93 million miles (149.6 million kilometers) from Earth.

questionsData.title: The front part of the ship is called a mast.
The text is mainly talking about…….
questionsData.article: Air is a mixture of invisible gases, mainly oxygen and nitrogen, that surrounds Earth, It is about one-fifth oxygen and four nitrogen, There are small amounts of water vapor and carbon dioxide in the air. These gases make up less than one percent of air, air has a lot of power, it takes up space, On the surface of Earth, we are at the bottom of a layer of air. The weight of air pushing own on Earth's surface helps create air pressure, When there is less air around you, less pressureis felt, This is a low-pressure area, Cold air helps create high-pressure areas. It is also a big factor in wind and weather, When there is a difference in air reassure, air is moved, The movement of air is wind, Air pressure and wind affect the weather. Storms develop when there are rapid changes in temperature and air pressure, Hurricanes, thunderstorms, and gentle breezes are all caused by wind and changes air pressure. Air is odorless; we can't smell it. It is also tasteless and invisible Without air, people and other living organism ouldn't survive, Air allows plants and animals to exchange the oxygen and carbon dioxide that all living things need to survive,

questionsData.title: …… women live longer than men.
questionsData.explain_answer: In English, when we are talking about a general category or group, we usually omit the definite article "the."

questionsData.title: Sally is the same ……….. as me.
…………. the traffic was bad, I arrived on time.
She eats her food very……
I saw shadows ….. on the wall.
Fatima is going to ….. her school.
The food …. by mum .
questionsData.explain_answer:
In the sentence "The food was cooked by mum," the verb "cooked" is in the past tense.

The past tense is used to describe actions that happened and were completed in the past. In this case, it indicates that the cooking of the food by mum was done in the past. The use of "was cooked" implies that the action of cooking took place before the current moment of speaking or writing.

questionsData.title: The man ….. I met an hour ago is a teacher .
questionsData.explain_answer:
Relative clauses are used to provide additional information about a noun or pronoun within a sentence. They begin with relative pronouns such as "who," "whom," "whose," "which," or "that." 

When referring to people, it is more appropriate to use "who" or "whom" as relative pronouns.
